revised_title: Ireland's Extinct Giant Deer: The Moose and Its Large Horns
tldr: The author, Thomas Molyneux, discusses the discovery of large horns found buried underground in Ireland, concluding that the giant deer, known as a moose, was once common in the region. He describes the physical characteristics of the deer and its horns, as well as the process of growth and shedding. Molyneux also compares the deer's horn growth to the growth of vegetables and the dropping of fruit from trees, suggesting a similar mechanism in both processes.
